title: Re: Potential Anomalous Activity
content:
[[>]] [[module Rate]] [[/>]] [[html]]  
Author's Note: For the best experience, please read this tale from top to bottom, in reverse chronological order.
It may help to read this tale first.
  

--------- Previous message ---------


From: Elanor Jones
Date: Mon, Feb 4, 2019 at 12:30 PM
Subject: PLEASE HELP
To: Wheeler, Marion

I don't remember everything. But I think I remember you. Where are you?

I think something is in my head. It is eating my memories. I don't know how to stop it.

And it thinks I am delicious.

Elanor

 

--------- Previous message ---------

From: Elanor Jones
Date: Mon, Feb 4, 2019 at 9:11 AM
Subject: re: RE: re: RE: re: RE: Potential anomalous activityNo
To: Tom Scannell

Sir: Given your response, I think we have nothing left to discuss. Please accept my resignation effective immediately.I just realized that I don't have a supervisor named Tom. I will not be contacting you any more.

Elanor Jones

 

--------- Previous message ---------
From: Tom ScannellINVALID ADDRESS
Date: Mon, Feb 4, 2019 at 7:35 AM (Failed to send)
Subject: RE: re: RE: re: RE: Potential anomalous activityEgregious violations of conduct
To: Elanor Jones

I am not interested in any more of this behavior. As you've now decided to go over my head without authority, I'm rapidly coming to the conclusion that this job is not for you. You are insubordinate and I cannot continue to consume so much company time on your behalf. Please begin clearing out your desk, if you don't mind.

Tom Scannel
C3 Supervisor, AccountingScannell. Scannell. Tom. Accounting.
CL-4/PC-C̷2̴z̵-T/PC-TOM-3/̵B̴3DD-C

 

--------- Previous message ---------
From: Elanor Jones
Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2019 at 9:23 PM
Subject: re: RE: re: RE: Potential anomalous activityFuck you
To: Tom Scannell

Sir, I refuse to apologize for messaging you so late this evening because people's lives are at stake. Don't patronize me. What I'm particularly concerned about is the impact in the event that I'm right. We're talking about a whole department, integral to the structure of the Foundation's work in memetics, that disappeared overnight.

Given what I feel is the urgency of the matter, I have put in a request to see if I can get approval to pursue this line of investigation as a special project. I understand I am not a researcher, but the matter is constantly weighing on me. I don't care if you like it or not. I know what I'm doing. I was trained in antimemetic containment. I don't remember my training, but I know I was trained. And I am winning this fight.

Elanor Jones
Senior Accountant
CL-2/PC-CCL-4/PC-B

 

--------- Previous message ---------

From: Tom Scannell?
Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2019 at 4:47 PM
Subject: RE: re: RE: Potential anomalous activityI will consume you until there is only a husk left where your psyche used to be.
To: Elanor Jones

Ms. Jones:

Have you considered speaking to an onsite therapist? I don't know how to put this delicately, but you are exhibiting erratic and unusual behavior. The other possibility is that you have interacted with something you should not have. Have you forgotten where you stand in this organization? Or what clearances you are authorized? I am considering placing you on administrative leave until you speak to a Foundation counselor. That's what they are trained for. Handling people who get nosy and fuck their own heads up.

Tom Scannel
C3 Supervisor, Accounting
CL-4/PC-C

 

--------- Previous message ---------
From: Elanor Jones
Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2019 at 12:35 PM
Subject: re: RE: Potential anomalous activityThe Numbers are wrong
To: Tom Scannell

I do not mean to make you feel as though I am undermining your authority or anything of the sort.Fuck you, Tom, I know what I'm talking about. I don't know how to explain it to you in a way you would understand. It's not real text and they're not real numbers. Please, let me ask you: what does this line say? I'm asking you to read it. Out loud, if that helps.Do you see this shit, Tom, Do you see this shit? What the fuck is this? And I know I've seen it before. I just don't know where. Someone told me about it. It was important. The numbers are wrong. The numbers are wrong. The numbers are wrong. The numbers are wrong. The numbers are wrong.

PO # | Vendor Name | Description | Amount

8̵B̴5̶8̶G̸9̶801685 | 8̴e̶1̸m̵ ̸J̸o̶4̷g̴u̶&̴Boze, Jurgen | d̴@̶q̶o̶ ̷c̴u̷2̴z̵#̵f̸o̵z̵ ̴n̶!̶p̸k̶s̷d̴5̶o̵m̵Data services consultation | %̷9̵B̴3̴S̷.̸!̸O̷$4845.70

I think that we need to have an in-person discussion about this. It's very important. Don't you see it? I know I'm not crazy, Tom. Please.I thought I was crazy, but I am not. I can see there is something wrong with the names and numbers. They are not real, but my mind passes over them. I have to find her. What happened to her? Why hasn't she contacted me? Does she even remember who I am?

Elanor Jones
Senior Accountant
CL-2/PC-C

 

--------- Previous message ---------
From: Tom Scannell
Date: Mon, Feb 3, 2019 at 7:35 AMMon, Feb 0, 0000 at 0:00 AM
Subject: RE: Potential anomalous activity
To: Elanor Jones

Ms. Jones:

You are making this unnecessarily difficult. I am sure you understand that, since you have been a foundation employee for as long as you have, you are entitled to certain opinions about the way we operate around here. I ask you deliver on certain tangible, reportable data, and you don’t. You constantly question decisions above your pay grade. And for the icing on the cake, you make ludicrous assertions about the management of budgets without any proof to back it up. This is unacceptable.

Tom Scannel
C3 Supervisor, Accounting
CL-4/PC-C
